docs.lead_paragraph: Top advisers from Hillary Rodham Clinton's presidential campaign are speaking with substance abuse prevention advocates in Iowa and New Hampshire as they develop campaign policies around drug addiction and treatment.

headline.main: Clinton Advisers Begin Developing Substance Abuse Policies
headline.print_headline: Clinton Advisers Begin Developing Substance Abuse Policies

docs.snippet: Top advisers from Hillary Rodham Clinton's presidential campaign are speaking with substance abuse prevention advocates in Iowa and New Hampshire as they develop campaign policies around drug addiction and treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: Virtually unnoticed and effectively unregulated, a system of housing known as “three-quarter” homes profits off the poor and desperate in New York City.

headline.main: A Choice for Recovering Addicts: Relapse or Homelessness
headline.print_headline: Choice for Addicts: Use Again, or Lose Home

docs.abstract: Some landlords in New York City that purport to help drug addicts are in reality intentionally keeping their tenants locked in cycle of rehabilitation and relapse in order to cash in on Medicaid kickbacks from drug treatment programs; existence of such homes, referred to as 'three-quarter' homes, points to systemic failure of government and institutions that tolerate or tacitly encourage them (Series: Profiting from Addiction).
docs.snippet: Virtually unnoticed and effectively unregulated, a system of housing known as “three-quarter” homes profits off the poor and desperate in New York City.

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Pregnant women often fear taking the antidepressants they rely on. But not treating their mental illness can be just as dangerous.

headline.main: The Secret Sadness of Pregnancy With Depression

docs.abstract: Pregnant women struggling with depression often are afraid to take antidepressant medication for fear of hurting their babies; refraining from treatment, however, can present dangers just as grave.
docs.snippet: Pregnant women often fear taking the antidepressants they rely on. But not treating their mental illness can be just as dangerous.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles County Federation of Labor says that such a provision would give business owners flexibility to offer more generous benefits packages.

headline.main: Los Angeles Labor Group Backs Minimum Wage Increase, Then Seeks Exemption
headline.print_headline: Labor Group Wants Out of a Law It Backed

docs.abstract: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor, umbrella group of local unions that backed nationwide push to increase minimum wage to $15 hourly, is appealing to Los Angeles City Council to exempt union workers from wage hike requirement enacted by city; argues provision excluding union workers would give business owners flexibility in offering better benefits packages in lieu of higher wages.
docs.snippet: The Los Angeles County Federation of Labor says that such a provision would give business owners flexibility to offer more generous benefits packages.

keywords.value: Los Angeles County Federation of Labor
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to an Op-Ed writer who argued that the Democratic Party has veered to the left since President Bill Clinton.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to an Op-Ed writer who argued that the Democratic Party has veered to the left since President Bill Clinton.

docs.lead_paragraph: After approaches, the giant health insurer is working with bankers at Goldman Sachs to explore its options.

headline.main: Humana Is Said to Consider Sale of Company
headline.print_headline: Humana Weighs Sale, as Merger Appeal Grows for Insurers

docs.abstract: Humana, one of country's biggest health insurers, is considering potential sale of itself after having been solicited by several competitors; stock soars as investors appear upbeat for consolidation in industry; bigger firms look more attractive as Medicare Advantage funding shrinks.
docs.snippet: After approaches, the giant health insurer is working with bankers at Goldman Sachs to explore its options.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED and JULIE CRESWELL

docs.lead_paragraph: A recanvass left Mr. Comer 83 votes behind Mr. Bevin, a wealthy Louisville businessman and Tea Party favorite, in the Republican primary.

headline.main: Matt Bevin Prevails as James Comer Concedes Kentucky Governor Primary
headline.print_headline: Conservative Challenger Prevails as Rival Concedes Kentucky G.O.P. Primary

docs.abstract: James R Comer concedes Republican primary to Matt Bevin in Kentucky's gubernatorial race after recount shows Comer slightly behind Bevin in votes received.
docs.snippet: A recanvass left Mr. Comer 83 votes behind Mr. Bevin, a wealthy Louisville businessman and Tea Party favorite, in the Republican primary.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks sank in afternoon trading after a report showed the economy shrank in the first three months of the year.

headline.main: Market Slides Back After a Downward Revision of G.D.P.
headline.print_headline: Weaker U.S. Economy and Gloom in Greece Weigh on Wall St.

docs.abstract: Stocks fall following report that United States economy contracted in first quarter.
docs.snippet: Stocks sank in afternoon trading after a report showed the economy shrank in the first three months of the year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Humana shares soared well beyond all-time high prices Friday afternoon on speculation that the company, one of the nation's biggest health insurers, might be up for sale.

headline.main: Report: Health Insurer Humana Considering a Sale
headline.print_headline: Report: Health Insurer Humana Considering a Sale

docs.snippet: Humana shares soared well beyond all-time high prices Friday afternoon on speculation that the company, one of the nation's biggest health insurers, might be up for sale.

docs.lead_paragraph: James Comer conceded, Matt Bevin accepted and Kentucky's race for governor finally got underway Friday following a tumultuous primary that left Democrats giddy and Republicans focused on uniting their scattered base.

headline.main: After Close Primary, Kentucky Governor's Race Gets Underway
headline.print_headline: After Close Primary, Kentucky Governor's Race Gets Underway

docs.snippet: James Comer conceded, Matt Bevin accepted and Kentucky's race for governor finally got underway Friday following a tumultuous primary that left Democrats giddy and Republicans focused on uniting their scattered base.
